nodes.text: A vocal emulator implant, also known as a voxscrambler, was a type of cybernetic implant capable of connecting to the vocal chords of an individual. With just a thought, a user could change the tone and tenor of their voice to sound like a being of any age, voice depth, or even species. Like cyber disguises, vocal emulator implants allowed its users to mimic specific individuals given enough study and practice. The cost of a vocal emulator implant was 1,300 credits.
Vocal emulator implants were mentioned in Gadgets and Gear, a roleplaying supplementary sourcebook for the Star Wars Roleplaying series that was published by Fantasy Flight Games in 2019.
